jpo
Class PictureViewer

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  jpo.PictureViewer
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, AdvanceTimerInterface, ChangeWindowInterface, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, PictureInfoChangeListener, ScalablePictureListener, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener
public class PictureViewer
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements ScalablePictureListener, AdvanceTimerInterface, ChangeWindowInterface, PictureInfoChangeListener, javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener

PictureViewer manages a window which diplays a picture. It provides navigation control the collection as well as mouse and keyboard control over the zooming

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

myJFrame

public javax.swing.JFrame myJFrame
The PictureViewer is deliberately just a JPanel so that it can attach itself to a JFrame. The JFrame will be destroyed and recrecated depending on how the user would like to see this window.

previousJButton

private javax.swing.JButton previousJButton
Button that is put in the NavigationPanel to allow the user to navigate to the previous picture. The changePicture(jpo.SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode) analyses the context (previous pictures in the group, picture in previous group, beginning of pictures) and displayes the icon iconPrevious, iconPrevPrev iconNoPrev as appropriate.

advanceTimer

private AdvanceTimer advanceTimer
the timer that can call back into the object with the instruction to load the next image

pictureNodesArrayList

private java.util.ArrayList pictureNodesArrayList
a brute force way of getting a random picture out of the JTree. I copy all Nodes (or rather a reference to them) to the ArrayList and then use random to access an element

changeWindowPopupMenu

private ChangeWindowPopupMenu changeWindowPopupMenu
popup menu for window mode changing

Constructor Detail

PictureViewer

public PictureViewer()
Brings up a window in which a picture node is displayed. This class handles all the user interaction such as zoom in / out, drag, navigation, information display and keyboard keys.

Method Detail

switchWindowMode

public void switchWindowMode(int newMode)
request that the window mode be changed.

Specified by:
switchWindowMode in interface ChangeWindowInterface
Parameters:
newMode - The new window mode

switchDecorations

public void switchDecorations(boolean newDecorations)
This method turns on or truns off the frame around the window. It works by closing the window and creatig a new one with the correct decorations. It uses the decorateWindow flag to determine if the decorations are being shown.

Specified by:
switchDecorations in interface ChangeWindowInterface
Parameters:
newDecorations - Set to true if you want a frame, false if you do not.

createWindow

private void createWindow()
Method that creates the JFrame and attaches the this JPanel object to it.

closeMyWindow

private void closeMyWindow()
method to close the active window.

closeViewer

private void closeViewer()
method to close the PictureViewer. This different from closing the window in which the PictureViewer is being displayed because unlike most apps I have in this instance chosen the the JPanel owns the JFrame which displays it. This is to allow the JPanel to open and close the JFrame with different options upon user request.

requestScreenSizeMenu

private void requestScreenSizeMenu()
method to toggle to a frameless window.

requestPopupMenu

private void requestPopupMenu()
method to toggle to a frameless window.

changePicture

public void changePicture(SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode node)
Changes the displayed picture to that of the supplied node. It checks the preceeding and following nodes in the JTree and sets the previous and next buttons' icons accordingly.

Parameters:
node - The node whose userObject of type PictureInfo the PictureViewer is supposed to display.

pictureInfoChangeEvent

here we get notified by the PictureInfo object that something has changed.

treeNodesInserted in interface javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener

treeNodesRemoved

public void treeNodesRemoved(javax.swing.event.TreeModelEvent e)
The TreeModelListener interface tells us of tree node removal events. We use this here to determine if the node being displayed is the one removed or whether it is a child of the removed nodes. If so we close the window.

Specified by:
treeNodesRemoved in interface javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener

treeStructureChanged

public void treeStructureChanged(javax.swing.event.TreeModelEvent e)
implemented here to satisfy the TreeModelListener interface; not used.

Specified by:
treeStructureChanged in interface javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener

setIconDecorations

public void setIconDecorations()
This method looks at the position the currentNode is in regard to it's siblings and changes the forward and back icons to reflect the position of the current node.

requestNextPicture

public void requestNextPicture()
This method is invoked by the GUI button or keyboard shortcut to advance the picture. It calls SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode.getNextPicture() to find the image. If the call returned a non null node changePicture(jpo.SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode) is called to request the loading and display of the new picture.

See Also:
requestPriorPicture()

requestAutoAdvance

private void requestAutoAdvance()
method that cancels a timer is one is running or calls the method to bring up the dialog.

readyToAdvance

public boolean readyToAdvance()
method that tells the AdvanceTimer whether it is ok to advance the picture or not This important to avoice the submission of new picture requests before the old ones have been met.

Specified by:
readyToAdvance in interface AdvanceTimerInterface
Returns:
True if the next picture can be advanced, false if not.

doAutoAdvanceDialog

private void doAutoAdvanceDialog()
method that brings up a dialog box and asks the user how he would like autoadvance to work

enumerateAndAddToList

public void enumerateAndAddToList(java.util.ArrayList myList,
                                  SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode startNode)
method that enumerates groupNodes and adds picture nodes to an ArrayList

requestAdvance

public void requestAdvance()
this method is invoked from the timer thread that notifies our oject that it is time to advance to the next picture.

Specified by:
requestAdvance in interface AdvanceTimerInterface

stopTimer

public void stopTimer()
method to stop any timer that might be running

getRandomNode

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode getRandomNode()
returns the next node in the group and if it reaches the end of the list starts from the of the group. If there are no nodes it returns null.

requestPriorPicture

private void requestPriorPicture()
if a request comes in to show the previous picture the data model is asked for the prior image and if one is returned it is displayed.

See Also:
requestNextPicture()

scalableStatusChange

public void scalableStatusChange(int pictureStatusCode,
                                 java.lang.String pictureStatusMessage)
this method gets invoked from the PicturePane object to notifying of status changes. It updates the description panel at the bottom of the screen with the status. If the status was a notification of the image starting to load the progress bar is made visible. Any other status hides the progress bar.

Specified by:
scalableStatusChange in interface ScalablePictureListener

sourceLoadProgressNotification

public void sourceLoadProgressNotification(int statusCode,
                                           int percentage)
method that gets invoked from the PicturePane object to notify of status changes

Specified by:
sourceLoadProgressNotification in interface ScalablePictureListener

resetPicture

public void resetPicture()
method to scale the picture to the current screen size and to center it there.
